channel.title: [HELP] Those cool jtextarea things with colors
channel.description:
OMG HAI
Okey, so I need a tut on working with those cool JTextArea things that can use colors...I forgot what it's called, but if any of you have seen ibot, the log thing is one of those things. It can use different colors and stuff.
I just need a simple tut on how to change the colors of certain text... ty.

item.title: [HELP] Those cool jtextarea things with colors
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:1, topic:62341”]OMG HAI

Okey, so I need a tut on working with those cool JTextArea things that can use colors…I forgot what it’s called, but if any of you have seen ibot, the log thing is one of those things. It can use different colors and stuff.

I just need a simple tut on how to change the colors of certain text… ty.[/quote]
use SWT. if you want the know the many reasons to msn: ruler_eric@hotmail.com

Read full topic
item.source: [HELP] Those cool jtextarea things with colors

item.title: [HELP] Those cool jtextarea things with colors
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

I posted this in another topic, but I guess I’ll post it again. This is for JTextPanes.

StyleContext sc = StyleContext.getDefaultStyleContext(); AttributeSet aset = sc.addAttribute(SimpleAttributeSet.EMPTY, StyleConstants.Foreground, color); yourTextPane.setCharacterAttributes(aset, false); int len = yourTextPane.getText().getLength(); setCaretPosition(len); //This is hax really. If the carat position is important, save it here, and then later set it back. replaceSelection(yourWord); //Well there isn't anything selected, so it just puts the text in?

Read full topic
